awd_titl_txt: U.S.-Australia Cooperative Research: Studies in Particle    Physics
awd_abstract_narration: 9515467  Wali      This award provides travel support for Dr. Kameshwar Wali from the   Physics Department at Syracuse University to conduct collaborative  research with Dr. Girish C. Joshi, University of Melbourne School  of Physics.  The work will focus on theoretical studies of  elementary particle physics.    This project will investigate models for unified theories of  elementary particle interactions within the framework of  noncommutative geometry and on mathematical objects such as  Octonians.  Noncommutative geometry, as outlined by  Prof. A. Connes, promises to be a suitable framework for quantizing  space, time and matter.  The investigators propose to study the  role of gravitational forces in the structure of magnetic  monopoles, particularly the nonabelian magnetic monopoles which  have an extended structure.  The work of Dr. Joshi in Australia is  supported through the Department of Industry, Science and Tourism  (DIST).
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
